questions.question_text: A technician is configuring a new web server and must have over 10TB of fault-tolerant storage, while minimizing the number of failure points. The applications on the server also require the highest performance available. Which of the following configurations would the technician MOST likely select?

discussion.content:
Hi! I recommend to check this RAID calculator
http://www.raid-calculator.com/default.aspx

It helped me a lot to understand this question.
Remember RAID 0 needs a minimum of 2 drives, RAID 1 needs a minimum of 2 drives, RAID 5 needs a minimum of 3 drives, and RAID 10 needs a minimum of 4 drives.

RAID 0 is not the answer because it doesn't provide fault tolerance.
RAID 1 provides fault tolerance but only 8TB of capacity.
RAID 5 provides fault tolerance and a capacity of 10TB.
RAID 10 provides fault tolerance and a capacity of 12 TB.

Because it needs over 10TB fault tolerant storage, I think that option D is the right answer.

Let me know your thoughts!

comments.content: RAID 10 will also provide the highest performance, which is a requirement
raid 10 is basically raid 1 combined with raid 0. so it needs 4 drives, 2 for data and 2 for backup, which makes 6+6=12

discussion.content:
How raid 10 has 12 tb storage... doesn't the question say only 6 tb
I'm confused

You can eliminate "A" after reading to fault-tolerant storage, because RAID 0 is for performance only, then you can eliminate "B" after reading that it requires the highest performance available, because RAID 1 is for fault-tolerance. It would be between "C" and "D", but I would say "D", because RAID 10 is RAID 1+0 or RAID 0+1.

Yea it makes sense I guess don't pay attention to the RPM speeds. If you type it into the website provided by @gcarmensb17 you can see it says 4x read and 2x write speeds versus 2x write from the RAID 5. Still a bad question.

comments.content:
Raid 1+0 has high fault tolerance because it will function with at least 2 of the 4 drive minimum(one from each pair of mirrors) 
secondly the total amount of usable drive space is 12TB...1 drive in each pair of mirrors will be an exact duplicate of the other drive in the pair...so you lose 6 TB on each side.

discussion.content: I am confused on how is D the correct answer.

questions.question_text: A user has reported application connectivity problems to the network administrator. The network administrator knows there have been firewall configuration changes recently by a security vendor and believes the issue could be related to a port being closed on the firewall. Which of the following should the network administrator do NEXT?

comments.content: Now that you say that it makes more sense. Answer choice "C" could have been worded like: "Verify the problem that the user is reporting to you."

discussion.content: This is a dumb wording question, but the answer should be C, <- C is worded as if its in the 5th step in verifying full system functionality but in actuality, you should test the user's workstation first whom is reporting the issue, before you even attempt another workstation ie. the source of the problem.
yeah I would swear English is not the native language for whoever writes these questions...

The network admin has a theory of the problem: it could be related to a port being closed.
So the question is asking us what's the next step in the CompTia's troubleshooting methodology.
See if the application fails on another workstation (Step 3. Test the theory)
Go into the firewall and open the port (Step 4. Establish a plan of action)
VERIFY system functionality on the user's workstation (Step 5. Verify functionality)
Document the issue for future reference (Step 6. Document findings)

So the answer is A
key word is "believes" the admin thinks the ports are closed....don't take her word for it..go and verify system functionality yourself. there's your answer

comments.content: The problem is network admin is the person who is fixing the problem and he believes it is firewall, so after and assumption, he needs to verify if he's correct

discussion.content: Troubleshooting theory 3 Once the theory is confirmed, determine the next steps to resolve problem. he identified the problem so B is the answer, he has to open up the ports.

think simple. 
1. identify problem,
2. make a theory
3. test theory. 
4.verify theory was correct.
this was step 3. he need to open the port to test the theory. C should be the verify step. 
think simple guy
i think its A, id first want to isolate the problem to the user's machine before beginning any troubleshooting. if it doesn't work on another workstation i know look at the firewall.

So the way I'm thinking about it is that C is right because you verify full system functionality to test if it's either an application problem or a full system problem. Trick question smh. I put A as well looking at the words. I didn't know they would try to trick you like this.

comments.content: You need to rule out if the user is making a mistake and that the problem is indeed happening before you go on to any other steps

discussion.content: This question is terrible the user is already reporting bad connectivity. Why would you go and try system functionality on his computer. Maybe because you can see if other applications are also slow and that would narrow down the firewall issue or if it's another network issue?
I thought too that it was A. Anyone know why it's the other one?

comments.content: by logic it shoudnt be an A because a port being closed on the firewall.. that mean all pc in the network should have same problem. so cross that from the answer. C is correct to confirm there is actual problem on the user pc.

discussion.content: Are you sure its not A?

choices.C: Verify system functionality on the user's workstation
choices.A: See if the same application fails on another workstation
choices.D: Document the issue for future reference
choices.B: Go into the firewall and open the port

choices.C: Update the smart wearable device firmware

discussion.content: This one could be either "A" or "C". I would say that he doesn't have bluetooth enabled though just with the information provided.

comments.content: True, i said the same thing. I think unless the question mentioned that both devices were paired and it still didn't synch; then choice C would've been the correct answer.
yes both A or C "CAN" be the answer but in most situation the MOST LIKELY cause is pairing and that's exactly what the question is asking.

questions.question_text: Joe, a user, reports that his new smart wearable device is not synchronizing to his mobile device. Both devices are powered on, but the mobile device fails to read the data from the wearable. Which of the following will MOST likely fix this issue?

choices.D: The laptop is configured with a static IP
choices.A: The laptop has an APIPA address
choices.B: The laptop is configured to the wrong default gateway
choices.C: The laptop is connected to the guest WiFi

questions.question_text: A technician is troubleshooting a WiFi issues with a laptop user in a corporate office. The user can connect to web pages without trouble; however, the user cannot connect to the email server or print a locally stored document to the network printer. The technician cannot ping the mail server or the network printer. No other users are experiencing this issue. Which of the following is MOST likely causing the issue?

discussion.content: The key words here are: "laptop in a corporate office", and "the user can connect to web pages without trouble; however, the user cannot connect to the email server or print a locally stored document to the network printer. The technician cannot ping the mail server or the network printer. No other users are experiencing this issue." The main thing is that the user can connect to web pages, but cannot connect to the email server nor the NETWORK PRINTER.
how is not B an answer? how do we know the laptop is connected in a guest wifi?

comments.content: because the user can access the internet and not the network printer etc, when youâ€™re connected to guest wifi you will not have the capability, but you will be able to use the internet

discussion.content: The laptop is connected to the guest WiFi

comments.content: The typo actually threw off my answer.

discussion.content: facilitates not facilities

PaaS Advantages
Simple, cost-effective development and deployment of apps
IaaS Advantages
Easy to automate deployment of storage, networking, servers, and processing power
Iaas since is cloud
I did not realize there is NaaS (Network as a Service). It makes sense, but it is not listed in most literature about cloud models.

comments.content: They need to deploy servers so the correct answer is Iaas = Infrastructure as a service. You need to know the difence betweer IaaS, PaaS and SaaS

discussion.content: Does anyone know where I can find more information regarding this question? I'm so confused by it.

questions.question_text: Which of the following cloud computing concepts facilities automated server deployment?
